description: This Java class `SecurityConfig` sets up basic security configuration for a Spring application. It defines a security filter chain that disables CSRF, specifies open access to certain endpoints (like Swagger documentation, health checks, and API info), and permits all other requests. It also includes placeholder methods for role-based authorization logic that currently always grant access, serving as scaffolding for future security enhancements.

classes.name: SecurityConfig
classes.description: Security configuration class for setting up HTTP security rules, role checking placeholders, and security utilities.

methods.name: filterChain
methods.description: Configures HTTP security to disable CSRF, permit certain endpoints, enable HTTP Basic authentication, and return the security filter chain.

methods.name: hasAnyRole
methods.description: Placeholder method that returns an AuthorizationDecision granting access; intended to check roles against the security context.

methods.name: role
methods.description: Creates a SimpleGrantedAuthority object with a role string, prefixing with 'ROLE_'.
